texts.value: Extracellular ATP-activated non-selective cation channel (PubMed:10440098, PubMed:7566119, PubMed:7566120). Plays particularly important role in sensory neurons where its activation is critical for gustatory, nociceptive responses, visceral reflexes and sensory hypersensitization (By similarity)

Has high sensitivity to ATP. Fast activation by external ATP. Exhibits rapid desensitization. Sensitives to the ATP agonist:alpha/beta-methylene-ATP (PubMed:10440098). Subject to allosteric inhibition by AF-219. Mg(2+) and Ca(2+) slow deactivation of P2RX3 (By similarity)
Homotrimer (By similarity). Forms heterotrimer with P2RX2. Heterotrimeric P2RX2/3 has a ligand dose-response profile that is distinct from either homotrimeric P2RX2 or P2RX3 (PubMed:7566120)
Localizes to neuronal cell body of sensory neurons
Contains extracellular allosteric binding sites-distinct from the orthosteric binding site
Belongs to the P2X receptor family

citation.title: Coexpression of P2X2 and P2X3 receptor subunits can account for ATP-gated currents in sensory neurons.
A P2X purinoceptor expressed by a subset of sensory neurons.
Ultrastructural localization of P2X3 receptors in rat sensory neurons.
Pharmacological characterization of recombinant human and rat P2X receptor subtypes.

Coexpression of P2X(3) and P2X(2) receptor subunits in varying amounts generates heterogeneous populations of P2X receptors that evoke a spectrum of agonist responses comparable to that seen in sensory neurons.

properties.value: Expressed in pancreas and 13 other cell types or tissues
C:hippocampal mossy fiber to CA3 synapse
F:extracellularly ATP-gated monoatomic cation channel activity
P:behavioral response to formalin induced pain
